01 Mar 2013

Diamond Lake makes for a Slippery Climb: Ontario Lakes Project

By in category

Diamond Lake in Bancroft Ontario is a mecca for ice climbers. There are steep cliff’s behind Bancroft’s main street where run off freezes over, creating the perfect conditions for adventure seekers. The spot called Eagle’s Nest is so popular that The Alpine Club of Canada’s Toronto Chapter takes members on several weekend-long expeditions which are well suited to beginner and expert levels.

If you’re keen to check it out, visit Mountain Equipment Coop to rent your equipment. If you’re at all curious, watch two climbers do their stuff just 2 hours away from Toronto.
